bitfield.description: TI internal data. Identifies revision of peripheral.
Always read as 0
If this bit is enabled, data formatting needs to be done outside
Write 1'b1 for reset assertion and 1'b1 for reset deassertion.
Always read as 0

Number associated with the ipgenericirq for intr output. Write 0x0: Write to input_intr Write 0x1: Write to output_intr Write 0x2: Write to ingroup_intr Write 0x3: Write to outgroup_intr Write 0x4: Write to error_intr Any other write value is ignored. Always read as 0.
Always read as 0

This signal is set to 1 when Left Channel OUTFIFO for SRC0 is underflowed
This signal is set to 1 when Right Channel OUTFIFO for SRC0 is overflowed
This signal is set to 1 when Left Channel OUTFIFO for SRC0 is overflowed
This is the number of samples that must be available for the interrupt and SRC0 OUTFIFOs event to fire. 1-32: 1-32 samples
This signal is set to 1 when Right Channel INFIFO for SRC0 is underflowed
This signal is set to 1 when Left Channel INFIFO for SRC0 is underflowed
This signal is set to 1 when Right Channel INFIFO for SRC0 is overflowed
This signal is set to 1 when Left Channel INFIFO for SRC0 is overflowed
This is the number of samples that must be available for the interrupt and SRC0 INFIFOs event to fire. 1-32: 1-32 samples

Setting this enables the Channels of SRC0. The output FIFOs for the stream must be enabled before the input FIFOs. 00: No channel enabled 01: Only Right Channel enabled 10: Only Left Channel enabled 11: Both channels enabled Clearing this register will clear the data path.
These bits select the word length for the SRC0 output data. The word length reduction is performed by utilizing triangular PDF dithering. 0: 24 Bits (Default) 1: 20 Bits 2: 18 Bits 3: 16 Bits

These bits select the interpolation filter group delay by configuring the number of samples which are pre-buffered prior to the re-sampler function. 0: 64 Samples (Default) 1: 32 Samples 2: 16 Samples 3: 8 Samples

These bits are utilized to enable or disable the digital de-emphasis filter manually. The de-emphasis filter is intended to process 50/15 s pre-emphasized audio material at the following input sampling rates. 0: De-Emphasis Disabled (Default) 1: De-Emphasis Enabled for fS = 48kHz 2: De-Emphasis Enabled for fS = 44.1kHz 3: De-Emphasis Enabled for fS = 32kHz
These bits are utilized to configure the SRC digital output attenuation for the stream Output Attenuation (dB) = N 0.5, where N = Attenuation[7:0]DEC.
Always read as 0

This bit selects the mode of the decimation function, either true decimation filter or direct down-sampling without filtering. DDN Decimation Function 0 Decimation Filter (Default) 1 Direct Down Sampling Note: Direct down-sampling should only be used when the output sampling rate is higher than the input sampling rate. When the output sampling rate is equal to or lower than the input sampling rate, the Decimation Filter must be used in order to avoid aliasing.
This bit enables or disables the SRC output soft mute function. 0: Mute Disabled (Default) 1: Mute enabled; output data set to all zeros.
This bit enables or disables the SRC filter s dithering. 0: Dithering Disabled (Default) 1: Dithering enabled
These bits select the word length for the SRC0 input data. 0: 24 Bits (Default) 1: 20 Bits 2: 18 Bits 3: 16 Bits

This selects the output clock zone for the stream0. It can select between the 4 external audio clock zones. Based on this number rate and stamp is passed to the Stream0 Sample rate converter from respective clock recovery loop. 00: This selects the Clock Recovery loop 0. 01: This selects the Clock Recovery loop 1. 10: This selects the Clock Recovery loop 2. 11: This selects the Clock Recovery loop 3. In this SoC other values are not valid.

This selects the input clock zone for the stream0. It can select between the 4 external audio clock zones. Based on this number rate and stamp is passed to the Stream0 Sample rate converter from respective clock recovery loop. 000: This selects the Clock Recovery loop 0. 001: This selects the Clock Recovery loop 1. 010: This selects the Clock Recovery loop 2. 011: This selects the Clock Recovery loop 3. In this SoC other values are not valid.
Always read as 0
